question: Why is a runners heart rate lower than a non runner
answers: A runners heart rate is lower than a non-runner's for two major reasons.
First, regular endurance exercise causes the heart to become stronger and more efficient, leading to a lower resting pulse.
Second, training increases the heart size so that it can push out a greater volume of blood with each contraction, further reducing the heart rate.
Additionally, the body's natural response to exercise is to increase the release of certain hormones, such as adrenaline and endorphins, which help to reduce the resting heart rate.</s>

question: Why are there only circular planets? Why can't there be square or rectangular ones?
answers: Planets are round because when they form, they are composed of molten material which is pulled towards the center of gravity, forming a sphere.
Since gravity always points towards the center of a mass, it squeezed the stuff the Earth is made of equally in all directions and formed a ball.
When the Earth cooled down and became a solid, it was a round ball.
If the Earth didn’t spin, then it would have been a perfectly round planet.
Scientists call something that is perfectly round in all directions a “sphere.”</s>

question: Why do french fries taste awful if reheated, but something like pizza is comparable whether fresh or reheated?
answers: Because french fries contain starches and oils that are susceptible to rapid and extreme changes with heat and microwave radiation, reheating french fries results in a soggy, limp mass and/or burnt ends.
Oil used to fry french fries also absorbs unwanted flavors and can become rancid over time.
In contrast, pizza contains mostly bread and cheese, which are more resistant to extreme changes with heat.
Furthermore, the high melting point of cheese means that it will not be as affected by microwave radiation, and the starches in the bread are less likely to cause a soggy, limp mess.
As such, reheating pizza results in a comparable taste to that of freshly made pizza.</s>

question: If I were to create a company, have $1M debt, go bankrupt, how would the company that I owe get its money ? do I have to pay ?

Secured creditors get their money back first, usually by taking back their property.
Unsecured creditors charge higher interest because of this higher bankruptcy risk.
Shareholders are last in line during the bankruptcy process and should expect to get a fraction of their investment returned, if at all.

question: Why do we use air filled tires and not tires made of solid rubber, that don't run the risk of going flat?
answers: Air-filled tires offer several advantages over solid rubber tires.
Firstly, air-filled tires can better absorb and dissipate energy, making the ride smoother and more comfortable.
This is because air-filled tires are able to deform and adjust their shape more easily than solid rubber tires, allowing them to better absorb shocks and bumps in the road.
Furthermore, air-filled tires also offer a lower rolling resistance (i.e.
they minimize wasted energy as the tire rolls, which, in turn, decreases the required rolling effort), making for a smoother ride.
This makes air-filled tires particularly useful for high-speed automobiles, since they are able to reduce the amount of energy lost while driving over bumpy roads.
Additionally, air-filled tires are easier and less expensive to manufacture than solid rubber tires.

Solid rubber tires, particularly when driven at high speeds, would face the exact same problems of tread loss, at a faster rate, and due to the solid composition of the tires, would cost more to produce and dispose of, as well as adding weight to the car as a whole, requiring more fuel expenditure.</s>

question: Why does a cold plastic bottle of water sweat?
answers: When a bottle is cold, the water vapor in the air around it condenses onto the cold surface.
This is because water vapor in the air is much less dense than liquid water, so it rises and cools until it reaches a surface colder than itself, at which point it condenses back into liquid form.
This is known as condensation.
This process, combined with the fact that cold surfaces make the surrounding air more dense, leads to the water droplets being trapped on the surface of the bottle.
This is why the outside of an ice-cold water bottle gets wet after leaving it outside for a while.</s>

question: Why oil and gas rigs may cause earthquake and falls?
answers: Oil and gas rigs can cause earthquakes and falls due to the process of fracking.
Fracking is the process of pumping a high-pressure mix of water, sand, and chemicals into a layer of underground rock in order to crack it and release oil and gas.
This practice can increase the pressure on nearby faults, causing them to slip and create tremors or earthquakes.
In addition, the disposal of wastewater into the earth can also cause falls if it occurs near an underground water source.
The increased pressure from the injected water can cause the water table to rise and cause a fall in the nearby surface.</s>

question: Why am I unstable on my bike when it's stationary but not when it's moving?
answers: When a bike is stationary, its wheels have no angular momentum and cannot resist any tipping motion.
This makes it easy for an external force, such as a push or a pull, to cause the bike to tilt.
However, when the bike is moving, the spinning wheels generate an angular momentum that resists any tipping motion.
This makes it much harder for an external force to cause the bike to topple.</s>

question: Scientifically speaking , how likely is it that our existence is extremely small?

question: Why do fish that live around coral reefs appear to be more colorful than fish that don't live around coral reefs?
answers:
Fish that live around coral reefs appear to be more colorful than fish that don't live around coral reefs because of the following theories: 

The first one was developed by Alfred Russel Wallace, a British naturalist, explorer, geographer, anthropologist, and biologist in the 19th century.
It supposes that fish coloration depends mainly on habitat.
Everything is colorful down on the reef.
Thus, the main function of colors is visual protection from predators.
The other idea is one developed by biologist Konrad Lorenz in the mid-20th century.

He suggested that fish are conspicuously colored to help them identify their own species in the crowded reef environment, where there is direct competition between not only other species, but also members of their own.
Consequently, colors may allow for individual recognition.
Even with some reef fish’s intricate color pattern, no two are exactly alike.
Based on the findings of one scientist, Gil Rosenthal, the fact that they live underwater rather than on land has a lot to do with it.
Things look much different underwater.
It’s darker, but light comes from a variety of sources, and that light isn’t always the same.

Therefore, fish need the various markings in order to: 

• Identify each other underwater.
• Identify predators.
• Identify competitors within the same breed.

Because fish live in different areas of the water, be it near the surface or deep in the coral reefs, they need to adapt to their environment, which is an additional theory about why fish are so colorful.
Another issue that factors into the equation is that humans can’t tell what fish see; truly, that would be almost impossible unless you were seeing through their eyes while they were still alive.
The fish, therefore, might not even know how beautiful they are, but have their own methods of identifying each other that humans don’t quite understand.</s>

This axis is a point in 2-dimensional space and in our world, which exists in 3 dimensions, this axis turns out to be a line.
The system rotates along a plane that is perpendicular to the axis.
Therefore, whenever particles collide, they may move in any direction, but all the up and down motion cancels out, always following the rule that the total spin in that plane must be constant.
Over time and after countless collisions, these particles lose their freedom in everything except 2-dimensional space, thereby aligning themselves in a plane.
Our Solar System is not actually a perfect plane, but is still well on its way to an ideal stage.
Pluto actually lies at an awkward incline, due to its low gravity and isolated orbit.
The asteroid belt, in its most oblique locations, also inclines at about 20 degrees from the main plane.
Aside from these few exceptions though, the power of angular momentum has left the planets of our solar system in a tidy, predictable plane.
Some 4.6 billion years ago, there was no planet Earth and the Sun had yet to form.
Instead, a huge blob of gas and dust floated about for millions of square miles.
Attracted by gravity, particles of matter gradually moved closer eventually resulting in collisions.

Whenever some particles collide, their new trajectories are random but although the new direction is impossible to predict the angular momentum must remain constant in an isolated system because the local gravitational effect of other bodies is negligible.

In time, the particles lose their freedom to move across all planes except a select 2D plane.
Because all that matter formed a disk, all in a plane, all of the planets formed in a plane as well.

question: If you put glasses from someone with dioptry, do you see like they see without them?
answers: If you put on someone else’s glasses with a prescription, or “dioptry”, you will not see like they see without them as the image you will see will be blurred and out of focus.
This is because the lenses in glasses are prescribed to correct a person’s vision and when worn by someone else, the glasses are no longer prescribed to their unique visual abilities.
Additionally, the lenses may not fit correctly, meaning the image will be further distorted or even split into two separate images, which can cause dizziness, headaches or eye strain.</s>

question: what is 'Magnetic moment'
answers: Magnetic moment, also known as magnetic dipole moment, is the measure of the object’s tendency to align with a magnetic field.
It is a vector quantity.
The objects have a tendency to place themselves in such a way that the magnetic moment vector becomes parallel to the magnetic field lines.
The direction of the magnetic moment points from the south to the north pole of a magnet.
The magnetic field created by a magnet is directly proportional to the magnetic moment.

The term magnetic moment normally refers to a system's magnetic dipole moment, the component of the magnetic moment that can be represented by an equivalent magnetic dipole: a magnetic north and south pole separated by a very small distance.
Higher-order terms (such as the magnetic quadrupole moment) may be needed in addition to the dipole moment for extended objects.</s>

question: What is the difference between sigma bonds and pi bonds?
answers: Sigma bonds are stronger than pi bonds because the atoms can form head-to-head overlap of atomic orbitals in a sigma bond, which forms a more stable bond.
Pi bonds, on the other hand, form only in addition to a sigma bond and involve the side-by-side overlap of atomic orbitals, which is weaker than a head-to-head overlap.
Furthermore, sigma bonds allow for free rotation of the atoms around the bond, while pi bonds do not because it involves breaking the pi bond.</s>

question: What is austerity?
answers: Austerity is a set of economic policies that a government implements to control its public debt.
It involves cutting government spending within a period of weak economic growth, which is a deflationary fiscal policy.
The effect of austerity on the economy depends on how much money is taken out of the economy and how much it effects private sector investment and consumption.
On one hand, it can reduce budget deficits and borrowing costs, but on the other hand, it can lead to higher unemployment and lower economic growth.
Keynesian economists argue that in a recession, austerity can be 'self-defeating' as spending cuts cause a fall in aggregate demand, leading to lower economic growth.
This leads to lower tax revenue and can offset the improvement from spending cuts.</s>

question: Why do we say "pair of pants/jeans/shorts" when talking about one item of clothing when they are clearly not multiples?
answers: According to some, the phrase “pair of pants” harkens back to the days when what constituted pants—or pantaloons, as they were originally known—consisted of two separate items, one for each leg.
They were put on one at a time and then secured around the waist.
Calling them a pair of pantaloons, or pants, as they were eventually known, made sense when there were two components.
The phrasing was retained even after pants were made into one complete garment.
However, there doesn’t seem to be much evidence in reference sources to support this theory.
Here is something that can be readily confirmed to explain this linguistic oddity, although it may raise more questions than it answers: the word pants is a plurale tantum.

The Oxford English Dictionary defines plurale tantum, which is Latin for “plural only,” as a “noun which is used only in plural form, or which is used only in plural form in a particular sense or senses.” Bifurcated items (things that can be divided into two), such as pants, fall into this category.</s>

question: Why do undocumented immigrants returning to Mexico drive down wages there, but proponents of relaxed immigration say they don't do the same here?
answers: Proponents of relaxed immigration usually point to studies that show immigration has a small, positive effect on wages and employment.
However, these studies generally focus on the short-term, and do not take into account the wider economic implications of increased immigration.
In addition, the studies usually do not take into account the specific effects of immigration from particular regions or from certain skill sets.
In contrast, research on the effects of Mexican immigration to the US show that it does have a negative impact on wages and employment in Mexico.
This is because Mexican immigrants tend to be relatively low-skilled and compete directly with native Mexican workers for jobs.
This leads to higher unemployment and lower wages for Mexican workers.
Thus, there are specific aspects of Mexican immigration that have a different effect than other types of immigration.</s>

question: How can a vehicle's air filter effect its gas mileage?
answers: A vehicle's air filter plays an important role in its fuel efficiency.
When the air filter is dirty, it restricts the amount of air that can enter the engine, resulting in reduced performance and fuel efficiency.
Dirtier air filters can reduce a vehicle's fuel economy by as much as 14%, so it is important to keep your air filter clean in order to maximize your vehicle's performance and fuel-savings.
A clean air filter also helps to reduce emissions from the vehicle and can even help improve the overall driving experience.</s>

question: Why do benches empty when there is a fight in baseball?
answers: Bench-clearing brawls in baseball are a form of ritualistic fighting that occur between teams when every player on both teams leaves their dugouts, bullpens, or benches, and charges the playing area in order to fight one another or try to break up a fight.

The bench-clearing brawl is an accepted outcome in baseball, as it results in numerical equivalence on the field, a fairer fight, and a generally neutral outcome, as managers and umpires usually intervene to restore order and resume the game.
Penalties for leaving the bench can range from nothing to severe.

Additionally, the first player to leave either bench or penalty box to join or start a fight is automatically suspended without pay for 10 games, the second player to do that is suspended for five games without pay, and the teams's face a fine of $10,000 for the first incident and a review of the incident by the commissioner for any further discipline.</s>

question: Why is eating burnt food bad for you?
answers: Eating burnt food is bad for you because when you cook food too much, you alter its nutritional content.
In addition, any fat cooked at 250°C (482°F) or higher loses its natural properties and becomes harmful to the body.
This is because burning food increases the content of carbon dioxide.
After ingesting these toxins, your body must process them prior to eliminating them.

If you often consume burnt meals, there comes a time when your body cannot effectively process toxins, causing them to accumulate in the body, which can lead to a degeneration of cells and various gastric or liver diseases.
In addition, burnt food is harder for your stomach to digest, so it has to spend more time and energy processing it.
This can cause an immediate feeling of having a heavy stomach, heartburn and digestive discomfort, giving rise to various gastric diseases that can become chronic illnesses.
Much has been said about the fact that eating burnt food causes cancer.
This link has mainly been made due to the fact that cooking food at high temperatures leads to the formation of certain substances which pass through your body once ingested.
Some of these have been linked to the formation of cancer cells.

Eating other foods that have been burnt, such as the most commonly burned and consumed food, toast, potatoes, and other pan-fried foods that are accidentally burnt also puts an individual at an increased risk of cancer.

Burnt foods contain the chemical compound acrylamide, which is formed during a reaction in the amino acids, sugars, and water found in potatoes, bread, and other foods when exposed to extreme temperatures.
This compound occurs in varying degrees depending on the amount of charring and the length of time they were exposed to the high temperature.
In 2007, a study done in the Netherlands indicated the risk of cancer increased when test subjects ingested acrylamide, especially in women.
Other studies with rodents have shown that exposure to acrylamide increases the chance of developing several different types of cancer.
Two research organizations, the National Toxicology Program and the International Agency for Research on Cancer both have named acrylamide a “probable human carcinogen”.
However, these studies were completed with laboratory animals that were administered acrylamide in drinking water.
Toxicology studies reveal a discrepancy in the amount of acrylamide absorbed and the rate of absorption between animals and humans.</s>

question: How did people manipulate photographs before computers?
answers: In the early history of photo manipulation, a photographer already had a few tricks he/she could use to improve the result.
Most commonly, they combined printing, exposure variations, photomontage techniques, and alterations on the negative.
From the very beginning, people wanted to improve the photos, much the same as people do now with the use of computer programs.
In the earlier times, people wanted to see the missing or even deceased relatives in their shots, do artistic experiments, and express political satire with their help.
Image retouching was carried out on a special table.
This is a device with a variable inclination angle of the working surface.
The negative was placed on a special frame and shone through from behind using an adjustable mirror or any other reflective surface.
There were curtains on top and sides.
They helped avoid stray light.
Modern image retouching techniques are improving every day, making the lives of many people involved in photography easier.
Today, anyone can easily remove or add any element to the photo.
When editing portraits, retouchers can enhance skin tone, remove its imperfections, whiten the teeth, and perform tons of other actions.
However, it is necessary to study the history of photo editing to know where it all began and in which direction to move on in the future.</s>

question: The Lean Six Sigma Methodology
answers: The Lean Six Sigma Methodology is a set of tools and techniques used to improve processes by reducing variation and waste.
It relies on data-driven decisions and a fact-based, customer-focused approach to process improvement.
The goal of Lean Six Sigma is to reduce costs and increase profits by increasing process efficiency and customer satisfaction.
Lean Six Sigma seeks to achieve this by identifying and removing processes that do not add value for customers, reducing cycle time and improving processes that do add value.
The Lean Six Sigma methodology utilizes two different approaches to process improvement: DMAIC and DFSS.
DMAIC is a data-driven approach that involves Define, Measure, Analyze, Implement and Control, while DFSS is a customer-centric approach that focuses on Define, Measure, Analyze, and Improve.
DFSS uses data to test hypotheses and gain insights, while DMAIC uses data to refine and improve existing processes.
In conclusion, Lean Six Sigma is a data-driven methodology that uses a variety of tools and techniques to improve processes.
It focuses on increasing process efficiency, reducing costs and cycle times, and ultimately increasing customer satisfaction.</s>

question: What causes us to tear up when we cut onions? Is there a way to prevent this?
answers: When we cut into an onion, its cells break and the contents inside are released.
This enables chemicals that were previously separated by a cell membrane to combine with each other and with the air.
Enzymes and "amino acid sulfoxide" chemicals from inside the cells react to produce a volatile sulfur gas.
This gas wafts up from the onion and reacts with the natural water in our eyes to form sulfuric acid.
This causes the familiar stinging sensation and tears that we experience.
There is not way to prevent this entirely, but some people find that wearing eye protection or slicing the onion under running water can help reduce the amount of tears that are produced.
Additionally, certain cooking methods can reduce the amount of sulfur gas produced, such as roasting, baking, or even deep frying.</s>

question: Why does smoking tobacco cause cancer, but smoking marijuana does not?
answers: Tobacco smoking causes cancer due to the presence of carcinogens and other toxic chemicals in tobacco smoke.
These chemicals are known to cause genetic mutations and cancer.

In contrast, marijuana smoking does not cause cancer due to the presence of cannabinoids, which have anti-tumor properties, as well as the fact that marijuana smoke contains fewer carcinogens than tobacco smoke.

This suggests that marijuana smoking may actually reduce the risk of developing certain cancers.</s>

question: after World War II, what changes did Germany make to it's own political system to ensure a dictator figure could never take power again?
answers: In the years after World War II, Germany made various changes to its political system in order to ensure that a dictator figure could never take power again.

The federal and state governments share political power, and the Basic Law also established barriers to radical, undemocratic tendencies.
These included the power to ban unconstitutional parties, and the adoption of a 5-percent threshold in elections to take seats in parliament.

question: Why is it harder to fall asleep in noisy environments?
answers: It is harder to fall asleep in noisy environments because noise disturbs sleep in a variety of ways.
Firstly, noise increases the time it takes to fall asleep.
Secondly, it also makes it easier to wake up during the night.
Thirdly, it alters the stages of sleep, leading to less deep and more shallow sleep.
Therefore, the noise makes it harder to achieve a restful night's sleep.
Additionally, it is important to note that different people have different tolerances to noise when trying to sleep.
Some may benefit from using a white noise machine (or a fan), putting in earplugs, or keeping a radio or television on low volume to drown out street noises.
Ultimately, it is up to the individual to judge what level of noise is tolerable and what level is too noisy to sleep.</s>

question: How do animals deal with getting prickles/thorns/splinters etc in their feet?
answers: Animals usually try to avoid getting prickles, thorns or splinters in their feet by avoiding tall grass or weeds, or other hazardous areas.
If an animal does get one, though, there are several methods they can use to try and remove it.
For example, cats and dogs will often lick the area and gently pull on the thorn to get it to come out.
Other animals, such as horses, rub the area with their foot to get the thorn to come out.
If the thorn is deeply embedded, or if the animal is a nervous one which cannot tolerate being handled too much, then a veterinarian may be needed to remove it.
In the case of splinters, animals may also use a combination of picking, pulling and tweezers to get it out.
Additionally, keep in mind that if the thorn is too deep or too hard to remove, it may mean it is best to just leave it.</s>

question: How were continents, countries and coastlines mapped out prior to the invention of satellites?

question: Seismologists: How do you determine whether an earthquake was naturally occurring or if it was human induced?

question: How does CRISPR work in a practical sense?
answers: In a practical sense, CRISPR (clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats) is a type of gene editing tool that uses RNA and Cas9 nucleases to target and cut off a segment of genetic material from a DNA molecule.

This is done by first isolating a specific sequence of DNA from an organism, then creating an RNA strand that hybridizes with the target sequence and directs the Cas9 nuclease to the targeted location.
Once the nuclease reaches the target, it cuts both strands of the DNA, thereby disrupting the gene.
The disruption of the gene can be repaired with the introduction of a synthetic DNA construct that contains the desired gene.
By using CRISPR, scientists are able to quickly and accurately make precise changes to an organism’s genetic material.</s>

question: Shutter Speed and Aperture.
answers: Shutter speed and aperture are both essential tools for the photographer.
Shutter speed determines how fast or slow the shutter closes to light in order to capture a photograph.
It allows you to freeze motion, as in a portrait photographer capturing a person’s expression, or to portray motion, as in a sports photographer capturing the moment of a dribbler’s successful shot.
Aperture, on the other hand, controls how much light is let into the camera, and thus impacts the highlights and shadows in an image.
A wider aperture will let in more light, while a narrower aperture will let in less, creating a depth of field effect.
This is especially useful for portrait photographers when capturing the subject’s expression.
By using a wide aperture, the foreground and background can appear blurred, giving the photograph a sense of focus on the subject.
The range of apertures also allows photographers to control the amount of light let into the camera, and thus control the brightness of the image.
All these elements combined can have an immense impact on the photographs we take, and mastering the use of shutter speed and aperture helps us to create unique and interesting images.</s>

question: Why is it that a fully buffered YouTube video will buffer again from where you click on the progress bar when you skip a few seconds ahead?
answers: YouTube's adaptive bitrate (ABR) algorithms work by breaking videos into small chunks which load as you go.
If your internet connection is slow, YouTube may make the next few seconds of video lower resolution in order to make sure you can still watch uninterrupted.
This is what causes the pixelation.
Additionally, if you try to skip ahead to a part of the video that hasn't loaded yet, your video stalls in order to buffer that part.
This is because the video player has to "catch up" to the user's requested position by loading the missing data.
YouTube uses these ABR algorithms to attempt to give users a more consistent viewing experience while also saving bandwidth.

Most people don't watch videos all the way through, so with 1 billion hours of video streamed every day, it would be a big waste of resources to buffer thousands of long videos for all users at all times.
Therefore, the player will decide what quality the video can reasonably run without interruption.
Thank you for your question!
If you have any more queries, don’t hesitate to let us know.</s>

question: What would happen to my body if I were trapped somewhere with a reliable water supply but no food
answers: After a day or two of being trapped in a remote location with a reliable water supply, but no food, your body would start to become depleted of glucose, and the level of glucagon would rise sharply in the blood.
This hormone would stimulate the liver to produce more glucose, which would be used mostly to feed the brain, as without food, the body starts to break down the stored fatty acids to use as fuel.
After a few days of being deprived of food, the only remaining source of fuel would be the breakdown of muscles and organs.
This would cause a drastic decrease in the availability of proteins, and as a result, your body would start to break down its own cells.
As cell breakdown increases, your body will eventually reach its peak level of adaptation.
Finally, with no nutrition still being provided, your body will begin to shut down, and you will eventually die.</s>

question: what do you do if you get pulled over?

question: Why do dogs shake their legs when you scratch a certain part of them?
answers: Dogs have nerves under their skin that cause their legs to shake when tickled, irritated, or stimulated.
Generally speaking, it's an involuntary response that helps protects dogs from sources of irritations including fleas and ticks.
Dogs have clusters of nerves located under the skin and this is what we refer to as the sweet spot.
The scratching activates the nerves and sends a message to the hind back legs via the spinal cord to start kicking in order to dislodge the source of irritation.
In addition, it may be a reflex that is hardwired in to protect the dog from possible parasitic threats.
This reflex is so reliable that veterinarians can actually use it to test for certain neurological problems.</s>

question: Why do some people dream deeply and vividly while others rarely remember theirs?
answers: There are several possible explanations for why some people dream deeply and vividly while others rarely remember their dreams.
One theory is that the regions of the brain that are important for dreaming are more active in those who have vivid dreams.

Additionally, some people may have a naturally higher ability to recall their dreams, due to increased activity in the hippocampus and surrounding areas.
Stress and trauma can also cause people to have more vivid dreams, making the events more memorable when the person wakes up.
Finally, some people may simply be better than others at interpreting and understanding their dreams, allowing them to remember them more readily.</s>

question: How does money go from my pocket, through the stock market, and to support the business I've bought stock from?
answers: When you purchase stock in a company, you become a shareholder.
As a shareholder, you are entitled to receive dividends from the company, which is a portion of the company's profits, as well as a portion of any appreciation in the value of the stock.
The money you put into the stock market can flow into the companies you invest in in several ways.
If you buy stock directly from the company, your purchase is usually a "direct purchase" of the stock.
This means that the company you bought from receives your money and you become a shareholder.
Other times, you may purchase stock through a stockbroker.
When you purchase stock through a broker, the broker is acting as an intermediary and is usually buying the stock on behalf of the investor.
The broker will then charge a commission for their services.
Ultimately, your money flows into the stock market, and then to the company you invested in through the broker.
The money you receive as dividends and the value of the stock appreciating will depend on the performance of the company.</s>

question: Why doesn't it thunder during snow storms?
answers: During a thundersnow, the snow itself acts as a sort of insulation and absorbs the sound of the thunder, dampening it and making it sound like a muffled timpani drum rather than the loud crackling and booming of a summer thunderstorm.
Bolts of lightning slice through the sky, creating an eerie look.
Air instability is also important to thunderstorm formation.
It commonly occurs when warm air near the surface of the Earth rises due to convection–in the classic case, on a sunny summer day when the ground gets hot and warms up the air immediately above it.
As the hot air rises, cooler air descends to replace it.

If conditions are right, strong updrafts can form that quickly move the warm, humid surface air up to the higher reaches of the troposphere, where the water vapor in the air cools and condenses to fall as rain (or ice, if it’s cold enough).
These updrafts are a hallmark of thunderstorms–the strong upward motion of the air encourages the interactions between water droplets and ice crystals that can lead to lightning.
In winter, cold surface air temperatures and reduced sunlight mean there’s less surface heating, less convection, and thus fewer opportunities for thunderstorms.
We usually have thundersnow at least a couple of times each winter.
Maine is in a kind of unique place, though, in which we can get arctic highs spilling in from Canada and colliding with warmer, wetter air coming up the Eastern seaboard and off the Gulf of Maine.
The most common "cold" thunderstorms are known as elevated thunderstorms.
These storms can occur when it is cold at the surface, but there is a warm layer higher up in the atmosphere that provides the energy to the storms.
Ever wonder why these elevated storms seem to have long, drawn-out thunder compared to thunderstorms that occur when it's warm at the surface?
With cold air at the surface and warm air above it, the warm air will act as a kind of ceiling, or insulator, to things like sound waves.
The sound waves from thunder will hit the bottom of the warm air layer and will bounce back to the ground, which causes the sound of thunder to last much longer.</s>

question: if I need pain relief, how do I know whether to choose between aspirin, Tylenol, Advil, etc.? They are all labeled as pain relievers.
answers: There are many pain relievers available over-the-counter, including aspirin, Tylenol, Advil, and ibuprofen.
Each of these medications is labeled to treat pain and fever, but they each work a bit differently.
Aspirin works by blocking the production of prostaglandins, which cause pain and inflammation.
Tylenol works by reducing the production of cytokines in our body which helps to reduce fever.
Advil and ibuprofen both work as anti-inflammatories and pain relievers by inhibiting the body's cyclooxygenase (COX) enzymes.
This reduces the production of prostaglandins and leads to pain relief.
Ibuprofen also works by inhibiting the formation of prostaglandins, which helps reduce inflammation.
Additionally, Advil and ibuprofen can be used to treat certain types of pain that are associated with inflammation, while Tylenol cannot.
In general, it is best to choose a pain reliever based on what type of pain you are having and whether or not the medicine has any contraindications with other medications you may be taking.

question: How does evolution occur and how did the first living organisms come about
answers: Evolution occurs when successive generations of organisms inherit different traits, which can be passed down to their offspring.
Over time, these changes can result in new species and even major changes in the structure of organisms.
The first living organisms likely arose from non-living chemicals around 4 billion years ago, in a process known as abiogenesis.
During this process, simple organic molecules were likely catalyzed by energy from volcanoes and lightning into more complex molecules, which eventually led to the first living cells.</s>

question: If I am not supposed to clean my ears deep with a q-tip, why does it feel so good and sometimes clear my sinuses?
answers: It might feel good because it stimulates pressure points in the ears, but it can also lead to minor trauma like abrasions and can make it feel like something is in your ear.
That can start a vicious cycle of further digging around which can lead to more damage.
Additionally, q-tips are not designed to reach the deepest parts of the ear canal.
They are too wide and can cause injury or damage to the skin of the ear canal.
Plus, they can spread infection and bacteria from the outer ear to the deeper areas of the canal.
Overall, it is best to leave the ears alone and let them self-clean.
In some cases, you may need help cleaning the ears, but routinely, that is not the case and you are doing more harm than good by playing q-tip doctor.</s>

question: Why are so many people choosing longboards over traditional skateboards these days? Are they easier to ride? What is the benefit?
answers: Longboards have become very popular with skateboarders today because they offer a smoother ride than traditional skateboards.
The design of longboards makes them easier to balance and they provide more stability due to their wider and longer size.
Additionally, longboards usually have thicker wheels which prevent tripping over the board.
Longboards are great for beginner skateboarders because they are easier to get the hang of, but they can also be challenging for experienced skaters due to their larger size and weight.
The flat nose and tail allow for more variety in tricks and the longboarding experience.
Overall, longboards are an excellent choice for those looking for a smooth and enjoyable ride.</s>

question: If most of what we taste is determined by smell, why do some things that smell good (cologne, perfume, soap, etc.) taste bad? (re-post/ rephrased from /r/explainlikeimfive)
answers: We usually associate smell with taste.
Since most of what we taste is determined by smell, it stands to reason that some things that smell good, like cologne, perfume, soap, etc., have an initial good taste to them.
However, over time, the taste can change due to our body's chemistry and the interaction of different components in the product.
This is why some people may find that a product at first smells pleasing but later tastes bad, while others may experience the opposite.</s>

question: Why are items always priced ending in ".99" instead of ".00"?
answers: Prices ending in ".99" are a psychological pricing technique used by marketers to make an item appear to be on sale, even when the markdown is minimal.
We tend to process the numbers before the dollar amount more, so the first digit of the price resonates with us the most.

Additionally, this type of pricing has become so common that price-conscious consumers have been conditioned to think they are getting a good deal when they buy something with a price ending in ".99".</s>
